item.title: By: Miraj
item.dc:creator: Miraj
item.description:
@Yunk
You'd be surprised how spectacularly that can fail, as well. What started as a plan for my faction to be the hardcore and the other to be the feeder guild turned disastrous. Unfortunately, I was on the losing end of the drama. And in Shadowbane, losing meant salted earth. Later, they instituted a policy where aiding or abetting "traitors" was grounds for guild dismissal in my honor.
item.content:encoded:
@Yunk

You’d be surprised how spectacularly that can fail, as well. What started as a plan for my faction to be the hardcore and the other to be the feeder guild turned disastrous. Unfortunately, I was on the losing end of the drama. And in Shadowbane, losing meant salted earth. Later, they instituted a policy where aiding or abetting “traitors” was grounds for guild dismissal in my honor.

item.title: By: steven v
item.dc:creator: steven v
item.description:
@foton,
"When you're back in <em>Azeroth</em> with the <em>Guild</em> again, you'll hear the hue and cry against me. From now on they'll spell mutiny with my name"
item.content:encoded:
@foton,

“When you’re back in Azeroth with the Guild again, you’ll hear the hue and cry against me. From now on they’ll spell mutiny with my name”

item.title: By: Kareem
item.dc:creator: Kareem
item.description:
This drama delivers, and will continue to deliver.
Pass the nachos!
item.content:encoded:
This drama delivers, and will continue to deliver.

Pass the nachos!

item.title: By: yunk
item.dc:creator: yunk
item.description:
I always thought in those situations it would be better to split into two guilds. one would be the casual and leveling and feeder guild for the other. No drama that way, and everyone gets to do what they want. What's wrong with letting people do what they want?
But I've never met a guild leader that was willing to do that (except I think Psae did it with his guild). So instead people leave and then there's no relation between the guilds. what good is that?
item.content:encoded:
I always thought in those situations it would be better to split into two guilds. one would be the casual and leveling and feeder guild for the other. No drama that way, and everyone gets to do what they want. What’s wrong with letting people do what they want?

But I’ve never met a guild leader that was willing to do that (except I think Psae did it with his guild). So instead people leave and then there’s no relation between the guilds. what good is that?

item.title: By: aaron
item.dc:creator: aaron
item.description: Makes me happy that my GM +raid leaders are officers and quite hard core. It allows more casual players to exist without bringing down the guild.
item.content:encoded: Makes me happy that my GM +raid leaders are officers and quite hard core. It allows more casual players to exist without bringing down the guild.
